suppress.notes: FP: quarkus-minio 3.7.7 is identified as the vulnerable 'minio:minio:3.7.7'. Our dependency tree confirms we use the non-vulnerable transitive dependency 'minio:minio:8.5.*'.

FP: CVE-2022-2403 is a server-side vulnerability in the OpenShift Container Platform, not a client-side flaw in the Fabric8 client or openshift-model JARs. The vulnerability is a misconfiguration on the cluster itself. The scanner has incorrectly attributed a platform CVE to a client library. The only fix is to upgrade the OCP cluster.

Downgrading severity from Medium to Low. This finding applies to the Pekko Management port. Mitigating Control: The port is only exposed internally within our Kubernetes cluster network and is not accessible from the public internet. The attack vector requires a prior breach of another service within the network. The fix will be scheduled as a low-priority technical debt item.

Suppressed - Not applicable. This SSRF vulnerability affects Nu Html Checker (validator.nu). Our application uses Hibernate Validator for bean validation only and does not include or depend on Nu Html Checker. Dependency analysis confirms nu.validator is not present in our project.

Suppressed - Not applicable. This SSRF vulnerability affects Nu Html Checker (validator.nu). Our application uses Hibernate Validator for bean validation only and does not include or depend on Nu Html Checker. Dependency analysis confirms nu.validator is not present in our project.

Suppressed - Not applicable. This SSRF vulnerability affects Nu Html Checker (validator.nu). Our application uses Hibernate Validator for bean validation only and does not include or depend on Nu Html Checker. Dependency analysis confirms nu.validator is not present in our project.

Suppressed - Not applicable. This vulnerability affects Element iOS, a Matrix protocol client for mobile devices. Our application is a Java/Quarkus backend that does not integrate Matrix protocol, use Matrix client libraries, or implement Matrix messaging functionality. This is a mobile app-specific vulnerability that does not apply to backend services.

Suppressed - Not applicable. This TLS hostname verification vulnerability affects Log4j's Socket Appender for network log transmission. Our application does not use Socket Appender - logs are written only to local files and stdout. The vulnerable component is not configured in our deployment.

Suppressed - Not applicable. This TLS hostname verification vulnerability affects Log4j's Socket Appender for network log transmission. Our application does not use Socket Appender - logs are written only to local files and stdout. The vulnerable component is not configured in our deployment.

CVE-2025-67735 is not applicable to our application context. The service does not expose public HTTP endpoints based on Netty and only provides headless/internal endpoints. No attacker-controlled HTTP request URIs are processed, and the vulnerable Netty HttpRequestEncoder code path cannot be reached. As a result, CRLF injection and HTTP request smuggling attacks are not feasible in the current architecture.

CVE-2025-67735 is not applicable to our application context. The service does not expose public HTTP endpoints based on Netty and only provides headless/internal endpoints. No attacker-controlled HTTP request URIs are processed, and the vulnerable Netty HttpRequestEncoder code path cannot be reached. As a result, CRLF injection and HTTP request smuggling attacks are not feasible in the current architecture.

Suppressed - Unused module. The module containing this vulnerability is no longer used in our application. The affected dependency has been removed from our project and is not included in any deployment artifacts.

This vulnerability affects Vert.x StaticHandler component used to serve static files (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, images, etc.). Our application does not use StaticHandler or serve any static content through Vert.x. We only expose REST API endpoints, therefore we are not affected by this cache poisoning vulnerability.
